title: If there are 40 students in a class & 4 of them are absent, then how would one find the percentage of present students? - Quora

response.answer_text: Its pretty simple.Total Students = 40 Absent = 4 Students Present = 40 - 4 = 36Now Coming to calculating percentage, always remember that Numerator will always be the term whose percentage is to be found and the denominator will be the total commodity available. And the resultant is to be multiplied by 100. therefore, percentage of students present = 36/40 x 100 Simplifying the above term = 9/10 x 100 = 90% Similarly % of absent students = 4/40 x 100 = 10%.Hope it helps.
